Class ProfileService

java.lang.Object
com.FeedEmGreens.HealthyAura.service.ProfileService
@Service public class ProfileService extends Object
Service layer responsible for handling user profile management operations such as viewing and updating user information, preferences, and account security.

This class interacts with the UserRepository to perform CRUD operations on user-related data and also manages initialization of Points entities when needed.

All business logic related to user personalization (e.g. dietary preferences) and account management (e.g. password updates) is encapsulated here, ensuring a clean separation from controller logic and repository access.

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • ProfileService

      public ProfileService()

  • Method Details

    • getUserProfile

      public Users getUserProfile(String username)
      Retrieves the full profile details of a specific user.

      This includes all persisted fields from the Users entity, such as email, preferences, and associated points data.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the profile to fetch
      Returns:
      a Users object containing the user’s profile information
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no user exists with the given username

    • updatePreferences

      public Users updatePreferences(String username, String preferences)
      Updates the preferences field of the user’s profile.

      This method allows users to save their personalized dietary preferences or other textual configurations that may influence the recommendation engine.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose preferences are to be updated
      preferences - the new preference string to be stored
      Returns:
      the updated Users entity after persistence
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the specified user does not exist

    • initializeUserPoints

      public void initializeUserPoints(String username)
      Ensures that a Points record exists for the given user.

      If no points entity is currently associated with the user, this method creates a new Points instance initialized with a total and redeemed balance of 0.

      This is particularly useful for backward compatibility or data migration where older users may not yet have points entries.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose points record should be initialized
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the specified user cannot be found

    • updateEmail

      public Users updateEmail(String username, String newEmail)
      Updates the email address of a user account.

      This method can be used during profile editing to replace the existing email address with a new one. It performs a direct update without additional verification checks.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose email is to be updated
      newEmail - the new email address to assign
      Returns:
      the updated Users entity
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user does not exist

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword(String username, String rawPassword)
      Updates the password of a user account.

      The new password is hashed securely using BCrypt before being stored, ensuring compliance with secure password handling best practices.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose password will be updated
      rawPassword - the plain-text new password to hash and save
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user does not exist
